intro: Acrostichum luridum, commonly known as the golden hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Acrostichum luridum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
